alert.note: Alert for Clay; Knox; Laurel (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 2:44AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Laurel, northern Knox and west central Clay Counties through 315 AM EDT... At 243 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pittsburg, or over London, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Fariston and Greenmount around 250 AM EDT. Maplesville, Levi Jackson S.P. and Mcwhorter around 255 AM EDT. Deer Lick, Langnau, Crawford, Lesbas and Benge around 300 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Marydell, Byron, Portersburg, Lida, Cane Creek, Fogertown, Hooker, Urban, Bush, Lake, Sasser, Grace, Blackwater, Tedders, Gibbs, Sidell and Sprule. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 1 and 17. Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 35 and 47. Kentucky Highway 80 in Laurel County between mile markers 5 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
